Info.Description:
The Warriors of Chaos, also known as the Hordes of Chaos, the Followers of Chaos, Chaos Undivided, the Northern Barbarians or simply just the Northmen, are the names given to a race of savage, warlike tribes of Human Barbarians that occupy the harsh and unforgiving lands of the uppermost North, known in the lands of the Old World as the dreaded Northern Waste.

To all those that face them, the northern barbarians are considered by all to be the enemies of all the world, whose unwavering worship to an uncaring and sadistic pantheon of ancient and evil gods has given them a single driving motive to usher in the inevitable downfall of all mortal-kind into their hellish enslavement.

Out of all the many threats that the Old World must face, none strikes such fear and misery into the hearts of Men like the Followers of Chaos. Slaves to darkness all, they have given themselves wholly to the Ruinous Powers, some willingly, others because they felt they had no other choice

Magic.Name: The Lore of Nurgle
Magic.Options: Lore of Death, Fire, Shadow, Heavens

Options.MarkOfNurgle: Rule: -1 to hit shooting and -1 WS in close combat
Options.MarkOfTzeentchWithCast: AddToWard: 6; Rule: +1 on attempts to cast spell
Options.MarkOfTzeentchWithWard: AddToWard: 5; Rule: +1 on attempts to cast spell

Weapon.Name: Chaos Daemonsword
Weapon.Rule: +D3 to Strength and +D6 Attacks, to a maximum of 10 (roll separately for these values at the start of each round)
Weapon.Description: A character with the Daemonsword adds D3 to his Strength and has an extra D6 Attacks, to a maximum of 10 (roll separately for these values at the start of each round). However, every roll of a 1 to hit in close combat is resolved against the bearer instead of the enemy. Furthermore, the character can never re-roll a to-hit roll of a '1' in close combat

Weapon.Name: Hellfire sword
Weapon.Description: Flaming attacks. Each unsaved wound caused by the Hellfire Sword causes not one but D3+1 wounds

Weapon.Name: Sword of Change
Weapon.Rule: Every time an enemy character or monster takes an unsaved wound it must take a Toughness test: if the test is failed, the victim becomes a repulsive Spawn-thing, all enemy models in base contact with the victim take a S4 hit, the victim is then removed from play
Weapon.Description: Confers +1 Strength. Every time an enemy character or monster takes an unsaved wound from the Sword of Change it must take a Toughness test. If the test is failed, the victim becomes a repulsive Spawn-thing. All enemy models in base contact with the victim take a S4 hit as the Spawn-thing flails wildly in its death throes (unsaved wounds will count towards combat resolution). The victim is then removed from play

Weapon.Name: Chaos Runesword
Weapon.Description: The wielder gains +1 Weapon Skill, +1 Strength and +1 Attack

Weapon.Name: Berserker sword
Weapon.Rule: Number of extra Attacks equal to the number of enemy models in base contact
Weapon.Description: The Berserker Sword confers a number of extra Attacks equal to the number of enemy models in base contact

Weapon.Name: Rapier of Ecstasy
Weapon.Description: Each time the Rapier of Ecstasy inflicts an unsaved wound on a model, that model must pass a Strength test or be removed from the game

Weapon.Name: The Father of Blades
Weapon.Rule: Any 'to hit' rolls directed against the model that result in the roll of a '1' instead hit the attacking model
Weapon.Description: Any 'to hit' rolls directed against the bearer that result in the roll of a '1' instead hit the attacking model

Weapon.Name: Axe of Khorn
Weapon.Description: This axe confers +1 Strength and the Killing Blow special rule upon the bearer

Weapon.Name: Filth Mace
Weapon.Description: All attacks with the Filth Mace count as poisoned attacks. In addition, if the bearer of the mace kills an enemy character in close combat, he will cause terror for the rest of the game

Weapon.Name: Rending Sword
Weapon.Description: A character with the Rending Sword may re-roll failed 'to wound' rolls

Weapon.Name: Whip of Subversion
Weapon.Rule: If an enemy character or monster takes an unsaved wound and that model has not yet made its attacks for that round, then the Chaos player may force it to allocate its attacks upon other models from its own side
Weapon.Description: If an enemy character or monster takes an unsaved wound from the Whip of Subversion and that model has not yet made its attacks for that round, then the Chaos player may force it to allocate its attacks upon other models from its own side. Wounds caused count towards the owning model's combat resolution

Weapon.Name: Glaive of Putrefaction
Weapon.Rule: Any model that suffers an unsaved wound from this weapon has its Strength and Toughness reduced to 2 for the rest of the game
Weapon.Description: Any model that suffers an unsaved wound from this weapon has its Strength and Toughness reduced to 2 at the end of that combat phase. This penalty is effective for the rest of the game

Armour.Name: Skinhidden Plate
Armour.Description: Chaos armour. The Skinhidden Plate confers +1 Toughness upon the wearer

Shield.Name: Chaos Runeshield
Shield.Rule: Negates the power of any magic or runic weapons carried by models in base contact
Shield.Description: Shield. Negates the power of any magic or runic weapons carried by models in base contact - treat them as ordinary non-magical weapons of their type

Armour.Name: Armour of Damnation
Armour.Description: Chaos armour. Any model striking the wearer in close combat must re-roll successful rolls to hit

Armour.Name: Crimson Armour of Dargan
Armour.Description: Chaos armour. The wearer is immune to Killing Blow. Furthermore, wounds suffered by the character can never be converted into multiple wounds - they do a single wound as normal

Armour.Name: Armour of Morrslieb
Armour.Description: Chaos armour. Confers a 4+ Ward save against non-magical attacks

Armour.Name: The Bronze Armour of Zhrakk
Armour.Description: Chaos armour. The bearer is Immune to Psychology and also immune to Killing Blow and Poisoned Attacks, which must roll to wound as usual. However, the bearer may never confer his Leadership to others. Artefacts of the Dark Gods

Additional.Name: The Beguiling Gem
Additional.Description: All enemy models in base contact with the bearer of the Beguiling Gem must take Leadership tests at the beginning of each close combat round. If it is failed, they may not make any attacks that round, and any attacks directed against that specific model (not the unit that model is in) will hit automatically

Additional.Name: Crown of Everlasting Conquest
Additional.Description: The bearer gains the Regenerate ability

Additional.Name: The Black Tongue
Additional.Rule: Once per battle can be used to automatically convert an unsuccessful spellcasting roll into a Miscast
Additional.Description: One use only. The Black Tongue can be used to automatically convert an unsuccessful spellcasting roll into a Miscast. The owning character then takes a wound that may not be saved by any means

Additional.Name: Blasphemous Amulet
Additional.Description: At the start of every friendly Magic phase, any enemy models in base contact with the bearer (including monstrous mounts) must pass a Toughness test or lose one wound with no armour saves allowed

Weapon.Name: Collar of Khorne
Weapon.Description: The model with the Collar of Khorne has Magic Resistance (2) and a 6+ Ward save

Additional.Name: Golden Eye of Tzeentch
Additional.Rule: Ward save of 4+ against all normal and magical missiles
Additional.Description: The model has a 4+ Ward save against all normal and magical missiles. This does not apply to his mount

Additional.Name: Necrotic Phylactery
Additional.Rule: Immune to the effects of spells from the Lores of Death and Nurgle
Automatically passes all characteristic tests (except Leadership tests)
Additional.Description: The model carrying the phylactery is immune to Poisoned Attacks, which must roll to Wound as normal. He is also immune to the effects of spells from the Lores of Death and Nurgle. Lastly, the bearer automatically passes all characteristic tests (except Leadership tests)

Arcane.Name: Skull of Katam
Arcane.Rule: The character and any other Wizards within 3" (friend or foe) add +1 to their casting rolls
Arcane.Description: The bearer and any other Wizards within 3" (friend or foe) add +1 to their casting rolls

Arcane.Name: Infernal Puppet
Arcane.Rule: May opt to modify any rolls on the Miscast table made by any Wizard on the battlefield by up to D3
Arcane.Description: A Sorcerer with an Infernal Puppet may opt to modify any rolls on the Miscast table made by any Wizard on the battlefield by up to D3. For instance, an enemy Wizard miscasts, and the Puppet's owner rolls a 2 on his D3, allowing the Chaos player to add or subtract up to 2 from the miscast result the enemy Wizard rolled

Arcane.Name: Blood of Tzeentch
Arcane.Rule: May re-roll one casting dice per turn, provided it was not originally a roll of a 1
Arcane.Description: A model with the Blood of Tzeentch may re-roll one casting dice per turn, provided it was not originally a roll of a 1

Arcane.Name: Power Familiar
Arcane.Description: The familiar adds one power dice to its owner's pool during each friendly Magic phase

Arcane.Name: Warrior Familiar
Arcane.Rule: Strength 5 hit on a single model in base contact
Arcane.Description: At the beginning of each Close Combat round, before blows are struck, the familiar inflicts one S5 hit on a single model in base contact with the Sorcerer, chosen by the owning player

Arcane.Name: Spell Familiar
Arcane.Description: The Familiar's owner knows one more spell than is normal for his level. This does not increase his Magic Level

Additional.Name: Rod of Torment
Additional.Rule: Bound spell, power level 4: magic missile that has a range of 18" and causes 2D6 Strength 3 hits
Additional.Description: Bound Spell, power level 3. The Rod of Torment holds a magic missile that has a range of 18" and causes 2D6 Strength 3 hits

Additional.Name: Bloodskull Pendant
Additional.Rule: Instead of making his normal attacks for that round, may choose to inflict a S8 hit on every enemy model in base contact, whith Killing Blow special rule
Additional.Description: Instead of making his normal attacks for that round, the wielder of the Bloodskull Pendant may choose to inflict a S8 hit on every enemy model in base contact. These hits have the Killing Blow special rule

Additional.Name: Book of Secrets
Additional.Rule: Knows a random spell from the Lore of Fire, Shadow or Death (player's choice)
Roll 1D6+1 instead of 2D6 on the Miscast table
Additional.Description: The bearer knows a random spell from the Lore of Fire, Shadow or Death (player's choice) and generates a single extra power dice, though he does not generate extra dispel dice. If the bearer ever miscasts, roll 1D6+1 instead of 2D6 on the Miscast table

Additional.Name: Helm of Many Eyes
Additional.Description: The wearer has the Always Strikes First rule. However, due to the random and conflicting images that confront him, the character is subject to Stupidity

Additional.Name: Pendant of Slaanesh
Additional.Rule: For each unsaved wound suffers he gains +1 Attack for the rest of the battle
Additional.Description: For each unsaved wound the character suffers he gains +1 Attack for the rest of the battle

Additional.Name: Death's Head
Additional.Rule: One use only. Thrown weapon with a range of 12", hit on a 2+, wounds with no armour by Toughness test
Additional.Description: One use only. The Death's Head is a thrown weapon with a range of 12". The Death's Head always hits on a 2+. Any unit hit by the Death's Head must take D6 Toughness tests, distributed as for shooting. For each failed test the model(s) that failed that test will take a wound with no armour saves allowed

Additional.Name: Favour of the Gods
Additional.Rule: After rolling on the Eye of the Gods table may add or subtract one from his roll, this may not affect the roll of a natural 2.
Additional.Description: After rolling on the Eye of the Gods table the bearer may add or subtract one from his roll. This may not affect the roll of a natural 2

Banner.Name: Banner of the Gods
Banner.Rule: All friendly units within 6" become Stubborn
Banner.Description: The model bearing the Banner of the Gods causes Terror. All friendly units within 6" of the banner become Stubborn

Banner.Name: Doom Totem
Banner.Rule: All enemy units with line of sight are at -1 Leadership
Banner.Description: All enemy units with line of sight to the Doom Totem are at -1 Leadership

Banner.Name: Banner of Wrath
Banner.Rule: Bound spell, power level 4: magic missile with range 24", causing D6 Strength 4 hits
Banner.Description: Bound spell, power level 4. The banner contains a bound magic missile with range 24", causing D6 Strength 4 hits

Banner.Name: Blasted Standard
Banner.Rule: 5+ Ward save against all attacks made in the Shooting phase
Banner.Description: The unit with the Blasted Standard has a 5+ Ward save against all attacks made in the Shooting phase

Banner.Name: Banner of Rage
Banner.Rule: Will never lose their Frenzy, even if beaten in close combat
Banner.Description: The unit with this banner has the Frenzy special rule. They will never lose their Frenzy, even if beaten in close combat

Banner.Name: Festering Shroud
Banner.Description: Any model that does not have the Mark of Nurgle and is in contact with the banner bearer at the start of the friendly Magic phase must pass a Toughness test or suffer a wound with no armour saves allowed

Banner.Name: Rapturous Standard
Banner.Rule: Any time a unit with the Rapturous Standard takes a Break test that includes a double or the roll of a 1, that roll is counted as an 'Insane Courage' result

Original.Rule: Troops within 18" may use his Leadership instead of the normal 12"
Archaon's army must include at least one unit of Knights of Chaos
Treats dangerous terrain as open ground, though any unit he is with suffers the normal penalties

Armour.Name: The Armour of Morkar
Armour.Rule: No attack against him may ever have a better chance to wound him than a 3+ roll

Armour.Name: The Crown of Domination
Armour.Rule: Any friendly unit within 12" of Archaon may re-roll failed Break tests

Original.Rule: Knows all six spells from the Lore of Tzeentch
Can use either of the normal Chaos Dragon breath attacks
Once per battle, can use the Breath of Change: models hit by the Breath must pass a Toughness test or be overwhelmed by horrible mutations - remove such models from play

At the beginning of each turn, Galrauch must take a Leadership test: if the test is passed, Galrauch will be controlled as normal, but if the test is failed, Galrauch will not move, cast spells or use his breath weapons, in the Close Combat phase he will direct half of his attacks against himself.

SpecialRules.Original: May always march, and treats dangerous terrain as open ground

Original.Rule: If targeted by a lightning-based attack, they become Frenzy

During the Shooting phase, choose an unengaged enemy unit within Kholek's line of sight and roll a dice: on a roll of a 2-6 a bolt of lightning hits the unit, inflicting D6 Strenght 6 hits, on the roll of a 1, the lightning hits Kholek

Armour.Name: Armour of the Storm
Armour.Rule: If any lightning-based spell targets a unit within 12" of Kholek, the spell's effects are redirected toward Kholek instead

Original.Rule: Any friendly unit within 12" of Valkia may re-roll failed Break tests
As long as she is on the table, any results rolled on the 'Eye of the Gods' table may be re-rolled

Armour.Name: The Scarlet Armour
Armour.Rule: Armour reduces the Strength of any attack against Valkia by 1 (to a minimum of 1)

Armour.Name: Daemonshield
Armour.Rule: All enemy models in base contact with Valkia at the beginning of each Close Combat phase lose an Attack (to a minimum of 1)

SpecialRules.Original: Knows all six spells from the Lore of Tzeentch

HandWeapon.Name: Vessel of Chaos
HandWeapon.Rule: When an enemy Wizard fails to meet the casting value of a spell, the power dice used for that attempt are converted to bonus dispel dice that Vilitch may utilise later that phase; conversely, should the enemy make a failed dispel attempt to counter one of Vilitch's spells, the dispel dice used for that attempt are immediately converted to bonus power dice that Vilitch may utilise later that phase

SpecialRules.Original: When making a pursuit move, Festus and any unit he is with will only pursue 1D6" as they begin to bind their captives; enemy units caught by Festus or his unit are worth double victory points

HandWeapon.Name: Pestilent Potions
HandWeapon.Rule: Any unit joined gains the Regenerate ability, though Wounds are only regenerated on the roll of a 5+ rather than the usual 4+
Any unit joined gains the Poisoned Attacks ability

Armour.Name: Mark of Nurgle
Armour.Rule: -1 to hit shooting and -1 WS in close combat

Original.Rule: Trolls, Ogres, Dragon Ogres, Warhounds, and monsters in the same army as Throgg may use his Leadership as if he were the army General and, if they are within 12" of him, may re-roll failed Break tests

Instead of attacking normally, can inflict D6 Strength 5 hits with no armour saves allowed, this attack is magical; once per game, Throgg can use his vomit as a breath weapon that inflicts S5 hits with no armour saves allowed
May force an enemy character to automatically accept his challenge, provided the chosen character could legally accept
Must nominate a single enemy model at the beginning of the game: when allocating his attacks towards the nominated model, gains +2 Strength and may re-roll all rolls to hit

HandWeapon.Name: Seafang
HandWeapon.Rule: Wulfrik and a single unit of Marauders may choose not to deploy as normal but to enter play from any table edge, exactly as if he and his unit had pursued an enemy off that edge in the previous turn: if this option is chosen, roll to see when Wulfrik and his unit enter play

Original.Rule: If Dracon Ogres Shaggoth are targeted by a lightning-based attack, they become Frenzy

Equipments.HandWeapon: Big rock, club or dead animal
